Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Conrad Firestein Photographs
Firestein, Conrad
Firestein, Conrad
PHOTOS.194
0.25 Linear Feet in 1 folder.
circa 1982 The Conrad Firestein Photographs contain one photographic print of the late photographer John Albok, shot circa 1982. Materials are in English
Historical/Biographical Note
Conrad Firestein is an Amsterdam-based photographer whose portfolio documents fashion, beauty, lifestyles, and interiors from the late-20th century through the present. The subject of Firestein's collection, the late John Albok, was a celebrated tailor and photographer best known for his images of New York shot during the Great Depression.
Processing Information Note
The Conrad Firestein Photographs were rehoused in February 2013.
Arrangement Note
The Conrad Firestein Photographs were arranged by an archivist within a single folder.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Conrad Firestein Photographs; PHOTOS 194; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Conrad Firestein sent, 2005. The accession numbers associated with this gift are 2005.042 and NPA.2005.008.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Related Archival Materials
John Albok Photographs, Part I: Negatives (PHOTOS 063)
John Albok Photographs, Part II: Photographic Prints (PHOTOS 063)
Scope and Content Note
The Conrad Firestein Photographs contain an 8"x10" black and white fiber-based portrait of the late tailor and photographer John Albok.
Firestein, Conrad Albok, John, 1894-1982
